api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.R.title: Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.Repositories | NeonSuit RSS Reader API
api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.R.summary: Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.Repositories Classes NotificationStatistics Represents comprehensive statistics about notification delivery and user interactions. Interfaces IArticleRepository Repository interface for managing Article domain entities. Provides comprehensive data access operations including CRUD, specialized queries, bulk status updates, duplicate detection, pagination, search, and maintenance tasks. IArticleTagRepository Repository interface for managing the many-to-many relationship between Article and Tag entities. Handles tag associations, bulk operations, removal, and usage statistics for articles. ICategoryRepository Repository interface for managing Category entities, which group RSS feeds into logical folders or collections with support for custom ordering, colors, and hierarchy. IDatabaseCleanupRepository Repository interface dedicated to low-level database maintenance, cleanup, integrity verification, and performance optimization tasks for the RSS reader SQLite database. IFeedRepository Repository interface for managing Feed entities. Provides comprehensive feed operations with support for active/inactive filtering, health tracking, and optimized data retrieval. INotificationLogRepository Repository interface for managing notification audit logs. Provides methods for tracking, querying, and analyzing notification delivery and interactions. IRepository<T> Generic repository interface defining standard CRUD, bulk, and query operations for entities in the NeonSuit RSS Reader application. IRuleConditionRepository Repository interface for managing rule conditions. Provides methods for condition management, querying, and validation within the rule engine context. IRuleRepository Repository interface for managing automated business rules (Rule entities). Defines the contract for rule persistence, querying, scoping, statistics, and condition retrieval. ISyncRepository Repository interface for synchronization state and history. Persists sync task configurations, statistics, and error history. ITagRepository Repository interface for Tag entity operations. Provides specialized methods for tag management, discovery, usage tracking, and article association beyond basic CRUD. IUserPreferencesRepository Repository interface for managing user preferences (UserPreferences entities). Provides strongly-typed and key-based access to user-specific settings with default value fallback.

api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.R.title: Interface IRssFeedParser | NeonSuit RSS Reader API
api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.R.summary: Interface IRssFeedParser Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.RssFeedParser Assembly NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll Defines the operations required to download, clean, and parse RSS/Atom feeds. Provides methods for initial feed discovery and incremental article retrieval. public interface IRssFeedParser Remarks This interface abstracts the RSS/Atom parsing logic from the rest of the application, allowing for pluggable implementations (e.g., different feed parsers, syndication libraries, or future enhancements like OPML support or full-text extraction). Implementations must ensure: - Robust HTTP handling (timeouts, redirects, compression, user-agent). - Proper feed detection (RSS 1.0/2.0, Atom, RDF, JSON Feed fallback if possible). - Sanitization of HTML content (XSS prevention, relative URLs to absolute). - Duplicate detection (GUID, content hash, link). - Efficient memory usage (streaming parsing, avoid loading entire feed in RAM). - Cancellation support for long-running operations. - Proper exception handling and logging of feed-specific errors. Methods GenerateReaderViewHtmlAsync(Article, CancellationToken) Generates a clean, ad-free HTML "Reader View" from an article's content or summary. Task<string> GenerateReaderViewHtmlAsync(Article article, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters article Article The article to generate reader view for. cancellationToken CancellationToken Token to cancel the operation. Returns Task<string> A standalone HTML document suitable for loading in WebView2. Remarks This method produces a standalone HTML document that: - Removes scripts, styles, ads, trackers, and unnecessary markup - Preserves readable structure (headings, paragraphs, images, links) - Uses simple, responsive CSS for clean presentation - Is fully offline-capable (no external resources) Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown if article is null. OperationCanceledException Thrown if the operation is canceled. ParseArticlesAsync(string, int, CancellationToken) Parses only new or updated articles from an existing feed URL. Task<List<Article>> ParseArticlesAsync(string url, int feedId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters url string The absolute URL of the RSS/Atom feed. feedId int The database ID of the existing feed. cancellationToken CancellationToken Token to cancel the operation. Returns Task<List<Article>> A list of new or updated Article items ready for insertion/update. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown if url is null or empty. ArgumentOutOfRangeException Thrown if feedId is less than or equal to 0. HttpRequestException Thrown on network or HTTP errors. XmlException Thrown on parsing failures. OperationCanceledException Thrown if the operation is canceled. ParseFeedAsync(string, CancellationToken) Parses a complete RSS/Atom feed from the given URL, extracting both feed metadata and initial articles. Task<(Feed feed, List<Article> articles)> ParseFeedAsync(string url, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters url string The absolute URL of the RSS/Atom feed. cancellationToken CancellationToken Token to cancel the operation. Returns Task<(Feed feed, List<Article> articles)> A tuple containing the parsed Feed metadata and the list of initial Article items. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown if url is null or empty. ArgumentException Thrown if url is not a valid absolute URI. HttpRequestException Thrown on network or HTTP errors. XmlException Thrown on XML parsing failures. OperationCanceledException Thrown if the operation is canceled.

api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.S.title: Interface IArticleService | NeonSuit RSS Reader API
api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.S.summary: Interface IArticleService Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.Services Assembly NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll Service interface for managing article-related business logic and operations. Acts as an abstraction layer between UI/presentation and data repositories, coordinating article retrieval, state changes (read/star/favorite), search, cleanup, and statistics. public interface IArticleService Remarks This service centralizes all article-related use cases in the RSS reader application, ensuring consistent business rules, validation, and transaction boundaries. It delegates persistence to IArticleRepository and related repositories. All methods return DTOs instead of entities to maintain separation of concerns and prevent leaking persistence details to the presentation layer. Implementations must ensure: All read operations are efficient and memory-safe (pagination, AsNoTracking, server-side filtering). State changes (read/star/favorite/notified/processed) are atomic and logged. Search supports full-text or keyword matching with relevance ordering. Cleanup operations (delete old) are safe and respect user preferences (e.g., starred/favorite protection). Statistics (unread counts) are cached or computed efficiently. Cancellation support for long-running operations via CancellationToken. Methods BulkMarkAsNotifiedAsync(List<int>, CancellationToken) Bulk marks multiple articles as notified. Returns Task<int> The number of articles successfully marked as notified. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown if articleIds is null. api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.S.title: Interface ICategoryService | NeonSuit RSS Reader API
api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.S.summary: Interface ICategoryService Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.Services Assembly NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll Service interface for managing category-related business logic and operations. Acts as an abstraction layer between UI/presentation and data repositories, coordinating hierarchical category management, feed organization, and optimized statistics. public interface ICategoryService Remarks This service centralizes all category-related use cases in the RSS reader application, ensuring consistent business rules, validation, and transaction boundaries. All methods return DTOs instead of entities to maintain separation of concerns. Implementations must ensure: All read operations are efficient and memory-safe (pagination, server-side filtering). Category operations maintain hierarchical integrity and referential integrity with feeds. Statistics are cached or computed efficiently to avoid N+1 queries. All operations support cancellation via CancellationToken. Methods CategoryExistsByNameAsync(string, CancellationToken) Checks if a category with the specified name already exists. Task<bool> CategoryExistsByNameAsync(string name, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default) Parameters name string The category name to check. cancellationToken CancellationToken A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete. Returns Task<bool> True if a category with this name exists; otherwise false. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown if name is null, empty, or whitespace. OperationCanceledException Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token. CreateCategoryAsync(CreateCategoryDto, CancellationToken) Creates a new category with automatic sort order assignment. Returns Task<CategoryDto> The newly created category DTO with generated ID and sort order. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown if createDto is null. ArgumentException Thrown if createDto has invalid data. InvalidOperationException Thrown if a category with the same name already exists. OperationCanceledException Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token. DeleteCategoryAsync(int, CancellationToken) Deletes a category by its ID. Returns Task<bool> True if deletion was successful; otherwise false (e.g., category not found). Exceptions ArgumentOutOfRangeException Thrown if categoryId is less than or equal to 0. InvalidOperationException Thrown if the category contains feeds and deletion is not allowed. OperationCanceledException Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token. GetAllCategoriesAsync(CancellationToken) Retrieves all categories with their feed and unread counts populated. api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.S.summary: Interface IDatabaseCleanupService Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.Services Assembly NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll Service interface for database maintenance and cleanup operations. Orchestrates cleanup workflows, manages configuration, and coordinates between business rules and data access layers. public interface IDatabaseCleanupService Remarks This service centralizes all database maintenance operations including: Automated and manual cleanup of old articles and logs Image cache management to prevent disk space exhaustion Database integrity verification and statistics gathering Configuration management for cleanup policies All methods return DTOs instead of entities to maintain separation of concerns. Implementations must ensure: All cleanup operations are transactional and can be rolled back on failure Resource-intensive operations respect cancellation tokens and report progress Image cache cleanup uses efficient file system operations with proper error handling Protected items (starred/favorite) are never deleted regardless of age All operations are logged with appropriate detail levels for debugging Methods AnalyzeCleanupAsync(int, CancellationToken) Analyzes the potential impact of a cleanup operation without executing it. api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.S.title: Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.Services | NeonSuit RSS Reader API
api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.S.summary: Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.Services Interfaces IArticleService Service interface for managing article-related business logic and operations. Acts as an abstraction layer between UI/presentation and data repositories, coordinating article retrieval, state changes (read/star/favorite), search, cleanup, and statistics. IArticleTagService Service interface for managing article-tag relationships. Provides business logic for tagging operations, batch processing, retrieval, statistics, rule-based tagging, maintenance, and event notifications. ICategoryService Service interface for managing category-related business logic and operations. Acts as an abstraction layer between UI/presentation and data repositories, coordinating hierarchical category management, feed organization, and optimized statistics. IDatabaseCleanupService Service interface for database maintenance and cleanup operations. Orchestrates cleanup workflows, manages configuration, and coordinates between business rules and data access layers. IFeedService Service interface for RSS feed management operations. Provides comprehensive feed management with support for active/inactive filtering, health monitoring, and synchronization capabilities. IModuleService Service interface for managing plugable modules. INotificationService Service interface for notification management and delivery. Provides comprehensive notification handling with support for different notification types, priority levels, and user action tracking. IOpmlService Service interface for importing and exporting RSS feeds in OPML format. OPML (Outline Processor Markup Language) is the standard format for RSS feed lists exchange between applications. IRuleEngine Service interface for rule evaluation engine that processes articles against defined rules and conditions. Provides comprehensive rule evaluation with support for complex condition groups and validation. IRuleService Service interface for automated rules engine management. Provides comprehensive rule lifecycle management, article evaluation, and action execution capabilities. ISettingsService Defines the contract for a centralized settings management service. Provides thread-safe access to application preferences with notification events. ISyncCoordinatorService Service interface for synchronization coordinator that manages and coordinates background tasks. Handles feed updates, tag processing, cleanup operations, and backups with proper prioritization, error handling, and resource management for low-resource environments. ITagService Service interface for tag management operations. Provides business logic, validation, and event notifications for tag operations.

api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Models.Clean.summary: Enum CleanupRiskLevel Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Models.Cleanup Assembly NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll Risk levels for cleanup operations, indicating the potential impact based on the percentage of articles that would be deleted. public enum CleanupRiskLevel Fields Critical = 4 Critical risk - more than 75% of articles would be deleted. High = 3 High risk - between 50% and 75% of articles would be deleted. Low = 1 Low risk - between 10% and 25% of articles would be deleted. Medium = 2 Medium risk - between 25% and 50% of articles would be deleted. Minimal = 0 Minimal risk - less than 10% of articles would be deleted.

Stores metadata, synchronization state, health indicators, caching info and retention rules. Optimized for efficient polling, conditional GET and low-bandwidth sync on constrained devices. [Table("Feeds")] public class Feed Inheritance object Feed Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This entity is central to feed management and includes: Core feed metadata (URL, title, description, website) Synchronization state (last update, next schedule, active status) Health tracking (failure count, last error, ETag for conditional GET) Content management (retention days, article counts) Categorization and organization Performance optimizations for low-resource environments: Indexed fields: CategoryId, LastUpdated, NextUpdateSchedule Cached article counts to avoid repeated aggregation queries ETag and LastModified support for bandwidth-efficient updates Constructors Feed() Initializes a new instance of the Feed class. Sets default values for timestamps, frequencies, and state properties. public Feed() Properties ArticleRetentionDays Feed-specific override for article retention period in days. Null = use global default, 0 = keep forever. public int? ArticleRetentionDays { get; set; } Property Value int? Articles Collection of all articles belonging to this feed. public virtual ICollection<Article> Articles { get; set; } Property Value ICollection<Article> Category Navigation property to the parent category (optional). [ForeignKey("CategoryId")] public virtual Category? Category { get; set; } Property Value Category CategoryId Optional foreign key to the owning Category. public int? CategoryId { get; set; } Property Value int? CreatedAt Timestamp when the feed was first subscribed/added. public DateTime CreatedAt { get; set; } Property Value DateTime Description Feed description or subtitle. [MaxLength(2048)] public string? Description { get; set; } Property Value string ETag ETag header value from the last successful HTTP response. Enables conditional GET (If-None-Match) to save bandwidth. [MaxLength(512)] public string? ETag { get; set; } Property Value string EffectiveRetentionDays Effective retention period in days (feed-specific override or global default). Not persisted in database. [NotMapped] public int EffectiveRetentionDays { get; } Property Value int FailureCount Number of consecutive failed update attempts. Used for exponential backoff and health visualization. public int FailureCount { get; set; } Property Value int HealthStatus Computed health status based on recent failures. Not persisted in database. [NotMapped] public FeedHealthStatus HealthStatus { get; } Property Value FeedHealthStatus IconUrl URL of the feed favicon or logo (preferably 64Ã—64 or larger). [MaxLength(2048)] public string? IconUrl { get; set; } Property Value string Id Internal auto-increment primary key. [Key] [DatabaseGenerated(DatabaseGeneratedOption.Identity)] public int Id { get; set; } Property Value int IsActive Whether automatic background updates are currently enabled. public bool IsActive { get; set; } Property Value bool IsPodcastFeed Indicates whether this feed primarily contains podcast/audio episodes. Set by parser or user override. public bool IsPodcastFeed { get; set; } Property Value bool IsUpdating Transient flag indicating an active sync operation is currently running. Not persisted in database. [NotMapped] public bool IsUpdating { get; set; } Property Value bool Language Detected or declared language code (ISO 639-1 or BCP 47). [MaxLength(16)] public string? Language { get; set; } Property Value string LastError Last error message or exception summary from the most recent failed attempt. [MaxLength(2048)] public string? LastError { get; set; } Property Value string LastFullSync Timestamp of the last full (non-conditional) synchronization. public DateTime? LastFullSync { get; set; } Property Value DateTime? LastModifiedHeader Last-Modified header value from the last successful response. Enables conditional GET (If-Modified-Since). public DateTime? LastModifiedHeader { get; set; } Property Value DateTime? LastUpdated Timestamp of the last successful fetch and parse. public DateTime? LastUpdated { get; set; } Property Value DateTime? NextUpdateSchedule Next planned synchronization attempt (used by scheduler). public DateTime? NextUpdateSchedule { get; set; } Property Value DateTime? Title Human-readable title of the feed. [Required] [MaxLength(512)] public string Title { get; set; } Property Value string TotalArticleCount Cached total number of articles stored for this feed. Updated after each successful sync or cleanup. public int TotalArticleCount { get; set; } Property Value int UnreadCount Cached number of unread articles (updated by business logic). Not persisted in database. [NotMapped] public int UnreadCount { get; set; } Property Value int UpdateFrequency Desired refresh interval for automatic background updates. public FeedUpdateFrequency UpdateFrequency { get; set; } Property Value FeedUpdateFrequency Url Canonical URL of the feed (unique across the database). [Required] [MaxLength(2048)] public string Url { get; set; } Property Value string WebsiteUrl Website/homepage URL associated with the feed. [Required] [MaxLength(2048)] public string WebsiteUrl { get; set; } Property Value string

api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Models.Notif.title: Class NotificationLog | NeonSuit RSS Reader API
api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Models.Notif.summary: Class NotificationLog Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Models Assembly NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll Audit log for all notifications sent to the user. Tracks delivery, interaction, and effectiveness metrics for analytics and debugging. [Table("NotificationLogs")] public class NotificationLog Inheritance object NotificationLog Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This entity records every notification sent to the user, including: Which article triggered the notification Which rule (if any) generated it Delivery status and any errors User interaction (clicked, dismissed, snoozed) Performance metrics (duration, timing) Used for: Notification history UI Analytics on notification effectiveness Debugging failed notifications Preventing duplicate notifications Performance optimizations: Indexed on ArticleId for quick history lookups Indexed on RuleId for rule effectiveness analysis Indexed on SentAt for time-based queries and cleanup MaxLength constraints on text fields to optimize storage Constructors NotificationLog() Initializes a new instance of the NotificationLog class. Sets default values for timestamps and delivery status. public NotificationLog() Properties Action Type of user action (clicked, dismissed, snoozed, etc.). public NotificationAction Action { get; set; } Property Value NotificationAction ActionAt Timestamp when the user interacted with the notification (clicked, dismissed, etc.). public DateTime? ActionAt { get; set; } Property Value DateTime? Article Navigation property to the associated article. [ForeignKey("ArticleId")] public virtual Article? Article { get; set; } Property Value Article ArticleId Foreign key to the notified article. [Required] public int ArticleId { get; set; } Property Value int Channel Channel the notification was sent from (e.g., "system", "rule", "manual"). [MaxLength(50)] public string Channel { get; set; } Property Value string Clicked Indicates whether the user clicked the notification. [NotMapped] public bool Clicked { get; } Property Value bool Delivered Whether the notification was successfully delivered. public bool Delivered { get; set; } Property Value bool Dismissed Indicates whether the user dismissed the notification without interacting. [NotMapped] public bool Dismissed { get; } Property Value bool Duration Notification display duration in seconds. public int Duration { get; set; } Property Value int Error Error message if delivery failed. [MaxLength(500)] public string? Error { get; set; } Property Value string Id Internal auto-increment primary key. [Key] [DatabaseGenerated(DatabaseGeneratedOption.Identity)] public int Id { get; set; } Property Value int Message Message body of the notification. [Required] [MaxLength(1000)] public string Message { get; set; } Property Value string NotificationType Type of notification (Toast, Sound, Both, Email, etc.). public NotificationType NotificationType { get; set; } Property Value NotificationType Priority Priority level of the notification (affects display duration and behavior). public NotificationPriority Priority { get; set; } Property Value NotificationPriority ResponseTimeSeconds Response time in seconds (time between sent and user action). [NotMapped] public double? ResponseTimeSeconds { get; } Property Value double? Rule Navigation property to the rule that triggered this notification. [ForeignKey("RuleId")] public virtual Rule? Rule { get; set; } Property Value Rule RuleId Foreign key to the rule that triggered the notification. Null if notification was triggered manually or by system. public int? RuleId { get; set; } Property Value int? SentAt Timestamp when the notification was sent (UTC). public DateTime SentAt { get; set; } Property Value DateTime Snoozed Indicates whether the user snoozed the notification for later. [NotMapped] public bool Snoozed { get; } Property Value bool SoundPlayed Sound played (if any). Null means default system sound. [MaxLength(255)] public string? SoundPlayed { get; set; } Property Value string Tags Tags associated with this notification for filtering and categorization. Stored as comma-separated values. [MaxLength(500)] public string Tags { get; set; } Property Value string TimeAgo Human-readable time ago string for UI display (e.g., "5m", "2h", "3d"). [NotMapped] public string TimeAgo { get; } Property Value string Title Title shown in the notification. [Required] [MaxLength(200)] public string Title { get; set; } Property Value string

api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Models.Prefe.title: Class PreferenceHelper | NeonSuit RSS Reader API
api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Models.Prefe.summary: Class PreferenceHelper Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Models Assembly NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll Helper methods for working with application preferences. Provides categorization for UI display, default value resolution, and comprehensive validation for all preference types. public static class PreferenceHelper Inheritance object PreferenceHelper Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This class works in conjunction with: PreferenceKeys - Defines all available preference keys PreferenceDefaults - Provides default values ISettingsService - Service that uses these helpers All methods are thread-safe as the class is static and immutable. Validation uses compiled regular expressions for performance. Methods GetCategorizedKeys() Gets all preference keys organized by category for UI display. public static Dictionary<string, List<string>> GetCategorizedKeys() Returns Dictionary<string, List<string>> A dictionary where keys are category names and values are lists of preference keys in that category. Remarks This method is designed to be used by settings UI to render categorized preference panels. Categories are localized in Spanish as the primary UI language. GetDefaultValue(string) Gets the default value for a preference key. public static string GetDefaultValue(string key) Parameters key string The preference key. Returns string The default value as a string. Remarks Defaults are defined in PreferenceDefaults. Returns empty string for unknown keys. GetEnumOptions(string) Gets the list of valid options for an enum-based preference. public static List<string> GetEnumOptions(string key) Parameters key string The preference key. Returns List<string> A list of valid option strings, or empty list if not an enum. Remarks Used by UI to populate dropdown lists for enum-type preferences. GetPreferenceType(string) Determines the data type of a preference based on its key. public static PreferenceType GetPreferenceType(string key) Parameters key string The preference key. Returns PreferenceType The PreferenceType of the preference. Remarks Used by UI to render appropriate input controls (checkbox, number field, dropdown, etc.). ValidateValue(string, string) Validates a preference value according to its key's validation rules. public static bool ValidateValue(string key, string value) Parameters key string The preference key. value string The value to validate. Returns bool True if the value is valid for the specified key; otherwise, false. Remarks Performs type-specific validation: Enum values: checks against allowed options Numeric values: range checking and parsing Boolean values: verifies "true"/"false" strings Colors: validates hex format (#RGB, #RRGGBB, #RRGGBBAA) URLs: validates URI format Time ranges: validates HH:MM-HH:MM format

[Table("Rules")] public class Rule Inheritance object Rule Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks Rules define automated actions to be performed when articles match specific conditions. Each rule includes: Conditions: Define what articles trigger the rule Scope: Restrict which feeds/categories the rule applies to Actions: What to do when conditions are met (notify, tag, mark read, etc.) Configuration: Priority, enabled status, execution order Rules can be simple (single condition) or complex (multiple conditions with AND/OR logic) using the UsesAdvancedConditions flag and Conditions collection. Performance optimizations: JSON fields store arrays of IDs efficiently Indexed on IsEnabled and Priority for fast active rule retrieval MatchCount and LastMatchDate for analytics without separate tables Constructors Rule() Initializes a new instance of the Rule class. api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Models.RuleC.title: Class RuleCondition | NeonSuit RSS Reader API
api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Models.RuleC.summary: Class RuleCondition Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Models Assembly NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll Represents an individual condition within a rule. Allows building complex logical expressions with multiple criteria. [Table("RuleConditions")] public class RuleCondition Inheritance object RuleCondition Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks Rule conditions are the building blocks for complex rule logic. Each condition evaluates a specific article field against a value using a comparison operator. Key features: Grouping: Conditions can be grouped using GroupId for AND/OR logic Ordering: Within a group, conditions are evaluated in Order sequence Negation: Each condition can be negated with Negate Rich operators: Contains, Equals, Regex, Greater/Less Than, etc. Example: "Title contains 'news' AND (Author equals 'John' OR Author equals 'Jane')" would use two conditions in group 0 (AND) and two conditions in group 1 (OR). Constructors RuleCondition() Initializes a new instance of the RuleCondition class. Sets default values for operators and flags. public RuleCondition() Properties CombineWithNext How this condition combines with the NEXT condition in the same group. public LogicalOperator CombineWithNext { get; set; } Property Value LogicalOperator CombineWithNextDisplayName Gets the display name of the logical operator in Spanish. [NotMapped] public string CombineWithNextDisplayName { get; } Property Value string DateFormat For date comparisons: format string (e.g., "yyyy-MM-dd"). [MaxLength(50)] public string DateFormat { get; set; } Property Value string Field Which article field to evaluate. public RuleFieldTarget Field { get; set; } Property Value RuleFieldTarget FieldDisplayName Gets the display name of the field in Spanish. [NotMapped] public string FieldDisplayName { get; } Property Value string GroupId Group identifier for organizing conditions (0 = default group). Conditions in the same group are evaluated together with the same logical operator. public int GroupId { get; set; } Property Value int HumanReadable Human-readable description of the condition for UI display. [NotMapped] public string HumanReadable { get; } Property Value string Id Internal auto-increment primary key. [Key] [DatabaseGenerated(DatabaseGeneratedOption.Identity)] public int Id { get; set; } Property Value int IsCaseSensitive Whether the comparison is case-sensitive. public bool IsCaseSensitive { get; set; } Property Value bool IsValid Indicates whether the condition is valid (has required fields for its operator). [NotMapped] public bool IsValid { get; } Property Value bool Negate Whether to negate this entire condition (NOT). public bool Negate { get; set; } Property Value bool Operator Comparison operator to apply. public RuleOperator Operator { get; set; } Property Value RuleOperator OperatorDisplayName Gets the display name of the operator in Spanish. [NotMapped] public string OperatorDisplayName { get; } Property Value string Order Execution order within the group (ascending). Lower values are evaluated first. public int Order { get; set; } Property Value int RegexPattern For Regex operator: the pattern to match. [MaxLength(500)] public string RegexPattern { get; set; } Property Value string Rule Navigation property to the parent rule. [ForeignKey("RuleId")] public virtual Rule Rule { get; set; } Property Value Rule RuleId Foreign key to the parent Rule. [Required] public int RuleId { get; set; } Property Value int Value Primary value to compare against. [MaxLength(500)] public string Value { get; set; } Property Value string Value2 Secondary value (for BETWEEN, NOT BETWEEN operations). [MaxLength(500)] public string Value2 { get; set; } Property Value string

Key features: Many-to-many relationship with articles through ArticleTag Visual customization with color and optional icon Pin functionality for frequently used tags Visibility control for tag cloud/UI display Usage tracking for popularity metrics Performance optimizations: Indexed on Name for fast lookups and search Cached UsageCount avoids repeated COUNT queries LastUsedAt for "recent tags" functionality Constructors Tag() Initializes a new instance of the Tag class. api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Models.html.title: Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Models | NeonSuit RSS Reader API
api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Models.html.summary: Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Models Classes Article Represents a single entry (article/item) from an RSS, Atom or JSON Feed source. Stores metadata, content, user interaction state and processing flags. Designed for efficient querying and low memory usage on low-end hardware. ArticleTag Join entity for the many-to-many relationship between Article and Tag. Stores metadata about when and how each tag was applied (user, rule, system). Optimized for fast lookups by article, tag, rule or application source. Category Represents a category (folder/group) for organizing subscribed feeds. Supports hierarchical nesting via parent-child relationships and custom sorting. Optimized for fast tree traversal, sorting and filtering in UI components. Feed Represents a subscribed RSS/Atom/JSON Feed source. Stores metadata, synchronization state, health indicators, caching info and retention rules. Optimized for efficient polling, conditional GET and low-bandwidth sync on constrained devices. NotificationLog Audit log for all notifications sent to the user. Tracks delivery, interaction, and effectiveness metrics for analytics and debugging. PreferenceDefaults Default values for all preferences. Provides a centralized source of truth for default configurations. PreferenceHelper Helper methods for working with application preferences. Provides categorization for UI display, default value resolution, and comprehensive validation for all preference types. PreferenceKeys Complete preference keys for all application features. Provides centralized key management to prevent typos and ensure consistency. Rule Represents a business rule for automated article processing. Supports complex conditions, multiple actions, and scope-based filtering. RuleCondition Represents an individual condition within a rule. Allows building complex logical expressions with multiple criteria. SyncError Records a synchronization error. SyncState Represents the overall synchronization state. SyncStatistics Aggregated sync statistics. SyncTaskConfig Configuration for a synchronization task. SyncTaskExecution Records a single execution of a sync task. Tag Represents a user-defined tag for categorizing and organizing articles. Tags are many-to-many with Articles via the ArticleTag join entity. UserPreferences Represents a single user preference stored in the database. Implements INotifyPropertyChanged to support two-way data binding in UI layers. Enums PreferenceType Enum representing the data type of a preference. Used by UI to render appropriate input controls. RuleHealthStatus Health status for rules based on recent activity.

api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Data.Configuratio.title: Class LogSettings | NeonSuit RSS Reader API
api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Data.Configuratio.summary: Class LogSettings Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Data.Configuration Assembly NeonSuit.RSSReader.Data.dll Configuration settings for the application's logging system. Implements INotifyPropertyChanged to support real-time UI updates. public class LogSettings : INotifyPropertyChanged Inheritance object LogSettings Implements INotifyPropertyChanged Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This class manages all logging-related settings including: Log levels and verbosity File retention policies Output targets (console, file, debug window) Log directory and file management Settings can be modified at runtime and applied via ApplySettings(), which updates the global logging configuration. Properties AvailableLogLevels Available log levels for UI dropdown binding. public static string[] AvailableLogLevels { get; } Property Value string[] CompressOldLogs Compresses older log files to save disk space. public bool CompressOldLogs { get; set; } Property Value bool CurrentLogFilePath Gets the full path to today's log file. public string CurrentLogFilePath { get; } Property Value string CurrentLogFileSize Gets the current size of today's log file in bytes. public long CurrentLogFileSize { get; } Property Value long EnableConsoleLogging Enables logging to console output (useful for debugging). public bool EnableConsoleLogging { get; set; } Property Value bool EnableDebugWindow Enables a real-time debug window for log monitoring. public bool EnableDebugWindow { get; set; } Property Value bool EnableFileLogging Enables logging to rotating files on disk. public bool EnableFileLogging { get; set; } Property Value bool EnableLogging Master switch to enable or disable logging entirely. public bool EnableLogging { get; set; } Property Value bool FullLogDirectory Gets the fully resolved log directory path. public string FullLogDirectory { get; } Property Value string Remarks Uses custom directory if specified and valid, otherwise falls back to LocalApplicationData\NeonSuit\RSSReader\Logs. LogDirectory Custom directory for log files. If empty, default location is used. public string LogDirectory { get; set; } Property Value string LogLevel Minimum log level to capture. public string LogLevel { get; set; } Property Value string One of: Verbose, Debug, Information, Warning, Error, Fatal MaxFileSizeMB Maximum size per log file in megabytes before rotation. public int MaxFileSizeMB { get; set; } Property Value int Range: 1-100 MB. Default: 10 MB. RetentionDays Number of days to retain log files before automatic cleanup. public int RetentionDays { get; set; } Property Value int Range: 1-365 days. Default: 7 days. SerilogLevel Converts the string LogLevel to Serilog's LogEventLevel enum. public LogEventLevel SerilogLevel { get; } Property Value LogEventLevel TotalLogSpaceUsed Gets a human-readable string of total disk space used by all log files. public string TotalLogSpaceUsed { get; } Property Value string Methods ApplySettings() Applies the current settings to the global logging configuration in real-time. public void ApplySettings() OnPropertyChanged(string?) Raises the PropertyChanged event. protected virtual void OnPropertyChanged(string? propertyName = null) Parameters propertyName string Name of the property that changed. ResetToDefaults() Restores all settings to their default values. public void ResetToDefaults() SetField<T>(ref T, T, string?) Sets a field value and raises PropertyChanged if the value changed. protected bool SetField<T>(ref T field, T value, string? propertyName = null) Parameters field T Reference to the backing field. value T New value to set. propertyName string Name of the property (auto-filled by compiler). Returns bool True if the value was changed; otherwise false. Type Parameters T Type of the field. api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Data.Logging.AppL.title: Class AppLoggerConfig | NeonSuit RSS Reader API
api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Data.Logging.AppL.summary: Class AppLoggerConfig Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Data.Logging Assembly NeonSuit.RSSReader.Data.dll Centralized Serilog configuration manager with support for runtime configuration changes. Handles logger initialization, persistence of settings, and log file management. public static class AppLoggerConfig Inheritance object AppLoggerConfig Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This static class provides: Thread-safe singleton logger instance Runtime configuration updates via UpdateConfiguration(LogSettings) Persistence of log settings to JSON Log file management (cleanup, compression, statistics) Usage: // Initialize at application startup var logger = AppLoggerConfig.InitializeLogger(); // Get logger for specific class var classLogger = AppLoggerConfig.CreateLogger<MyClass>(); // Update settings at runtime AppLoggerConfig.UpdateConfiguration(new LogSettings { LogLevel = "Debug" }); Methods ClearAllLogs() Deletes all log files in the directory. public static void ClearAllLogs() CompressOldLogsAsync(int) Compresses log files older than the specified number of days. public static Task CompressOldLogsAsync(int daysOld = 7) Parameters daysOld int Age threshold in days for compression (default: 7). Returns Task CreateLogger<T>() Creates a logger instance for a specific class context. public static ILogger CreateLogger<T>() where T : class Returns ILogger A contextual logger for the specified type. Type Parameters T The class type for context enrichment. GetCurrentSettings() Retrieves the current log settings. public static LogSettings GetCurrentSettings() Returns LogSettings The current LogSettings instance. GetLogStats() Gets statistics about log file usage. public static AppLoggerConfig.LogStats GetLogStats() Returns AppLoggerConfig.LogStats A LogStats object with file statistics. GetLogger() Retrieves the current ILogger instance. public static ILogger GetLogger() Returns ILogger The global logger instance. Exceptions InvalidOperationException Thrown if logger hasn't been initialized. InitializeLogger(LogSettings?) Initializes the logger with default or saved settings. public static ILogger InitializeLogger(LogSettings? settings = null) Parameters settings LogSettings Optional settings to override saved/default values. Returns ILogger The configured ILogger instance. Remarks This method is thread-safe and ensures only one logger instance is created. If settings are provided, they are saved and used; otherwise, saved settings are loaded or defaults are created. OpenLogDirectory() Opens the log directory in Windows Explorer. public static void OpenLogDirectory() UpdateConfiguration(LogSettings) Updates the logger configuration at runtime. public static void UpdateConfiguration(LogSettings newSettings) Parameters newSettings LogSettings The new settings to apply. Remarks This method closes the existing logger, saves the new settings, and re-initializes the logger with the updated configuration.

api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Setup.NeonSuitSer.title: Class NeonSuitServiceExtensions | NeonSuit RSS Reader API
api/NeonSuit.RSSReader.Setup.NeonSuitSer.summary: Class NeonSuitServiceExtensions Namespace NeonSuit.RSSReader.Setup Assembly NeonSuit.RSSReader.Setup.dll Provides extension methods for registering NeonSuit RSS Reader core services, repositories, infrastructure components, and AutoMapper profiles into an IServiceCollection. public static class NeonSuitServiceExtensions Inheritance object NeonSuitServiceExtensions Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This class centralizes all dependency injection configuration for the backend services. It follows Clean Architecture principles with clear separation of: Database context and EF Core configuration Repository layer (data access) Service layer (business logic) Engines and coordinators (background processes) Utilities and parsers AutoMapper profiles (entity-DTO mappings) Usage in Program.cs or Startup.cs: services.AddNeonSuitBackend("Data Source=rssreader.db"); // or with configuration services.AddNeonSuitBackend(configuration); // Ensure database is created/migrated app.Services.UseNeonSuitDatabase(); Methods AddNeonSuitBackend(IServiceCollection, IConfiguration, Action<DbContextOptionsBuilder>?) Registers all NeonSuit RSS Reader backend services using IConfiguration for database settings. public static IServiceCollection AddNeonSuitBackend(this IServiceCollection services, IConfiguration configuration, Action<DbContextOptionsBuilder>? configureOptions = null) Parameters services IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection to add services to. configuration IConfiguration Configuration instance containing connection string or database path. configureOptions Action<DbContextOptionsBuilder> Optional additional configuration for DbContext options. Returns IServiceCollection The same service collection for chaining. Remarks Looks for connection string in this order: Configuration.GetConnectionString("RssReaderDatabase") Configuration["Database:Path"] Defaults to "rssreader.db" in current directory AddNeonSuitBackend(IServiceCollection, string, Action<DbContextOptionsBuilder>?) Registers all NeonSuit RSS Reader backend services with explicit database path. public static IServiceCollection AddNeonSuitBackend(this IServiceCollection services, string dbPath, Action<DbContextOptionsBuilder>? configureOptions = null) Parameters services IServiceCollection The IServiceCollection to add services to. dbPath string File path to the SQLite database. configureOptions Action<DbContextOptionsBuilder> Optional additional configuration for DbContext options. Returns IServiceCollection The same service collection for chaining. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown if services is null. ArgumentException Thrown if dbPath is null or whitespace. UseNeonSuitDatabase(IServiceProvider) Ensures the database is created and all migrations are applied. Should be called once at application startup. public static IServiceProvider UseNeonSuitDatabase(this IServiceProvider serviceProvider) Parameters serviceProvider IServiceProvider The application's service provider. Returns IServiceProvider The same service provider for chaining. Remarks This method creates a new scope to resolve the DbContext and applies any pending migrations. It's safe to call multiple times (migrations are only applied once).
